summary.title: Saga Manuscript
summary.note: The manuscript consists of fragments from three manuscripts or parts, however written by the same scribe: 1) 'Ólafs saga Tryggvasonar' including þættir excerpted from 'Flateyjarbók', 2) 'Laxdæla saga' and 'Eyrbyggja saga', and 3) 'Njáls saga'.

msItem.title: Excerpts from Flateyarbók
msItem.bibl: Rafn, Antiquités Russes I 393-414 Extracts. Ed. þ

msItem.title: Ættartala
msItem.explicit: med tauldum bædí adam ok haralldi

msItem.title: Hverir konungar styrt hafa Noregi
msItem.incipit: Son haralldz harfagra var sigurdr hrisi
msItem.explicit:
eptir er hun
liet fanga albrict

msItem.title: Þorvalds þáttr tasalda
msItem.rubric:
Hier Hefr upp þatt þouvallde tasa
llda
msItem.incipit: Nv þesso at margar ræda ok fra sgur se ritadar
msItem.explicit:
ok settí honum þo opinberlíga skript
firir þenna lut

msItem.title: Sveins þáttr ok Finns
msItem.incipit: Þess er getit ok suo er rítad
msItem.explicit:
olafr konungr uar trẏgvason
olafssonar haralldz sonar haar fagra

msItem.title: Rauðs þáttr hins ramma
msItem.incipit: Rdr hinn ramme het madr einn

msItem.title: Þorsteins þáttr skelks
msItem.incipit: Þat er sagt vm sumarid eptir

msItem.title: Indriða þáttr ilbreiðs
msItem.rubric: hier hefr þatt einndrida ilbreids ok olafs konungs trygua sonar
msItem.incipit: A Nockurum tíma þa er olafr konungr hafdi míg albuit skíp

msItem.title: Gauts þáttr
msItem.incipit: Nv skal seígía luti er eg nam af frodum monnum
msItem.explicit:
enn þorarní
sagdí síalfr einar þambarskelfer

msItem.title: Þorsteins þáttr uxafóts
msItem.incipit: Þorkell. het madr er bío  krossa uík.

msItem.title: Norna-Gests þáttr
msItem.rubric: hier hefr þatt af norna gestí homir ol
msItem.incipit: Svo e r sagt at  einum tima.
msItem.explicit: vm lífdaga hans sem hann sagdí

msItem.title: Helga þáttr Þórissonar
msItem.incipit: Þorir het madr er bío j noregi
msItem.explicit: ok lẏkr hier fra grimum at seigía

msItem.title: Sneglu-Halla þáttr
msItem.rubric: hier hefr þatt af sneglu halla
msItem.incipit: Þat er upp haf þessarar frasagnar

msItem.title: Laxdæla saga
msItem.explicit:
ok lyk
ur þar nu sogunne

msItem.incipit: KEtill flat nefur het hersir einn

msItem.explicit:
eigi skal þat segir sig
mvndr
msItem.bibl: Eiríkur Jónsson and Konráð Gíslason, Njála I, 155:11-177:8 Ed. D
Eiríkur Jónsson and Konráð Gíslason, Njála I, 220:2-243:4 Ed. D

collation.p:
The manuscript consists of 8 quires:
I: fols 1+8, 2+7, 3+6, 4+5
II: fols 9+17, 10+16, 11, 12+15, 13+14
III: fols 18+26, 19+25, 20+24, 21+23, 22
IV: fols 27+33, 28, 29, 30, 31, 32 (fols 28+32 and 29+31 were once bifolios)
V: fols 34+38, 35+37, 36
VI: fols 39+40
VII: fols 41+47, 42+46, 43+45, 44
VIII: fol. 48

condition.p: The manuscript is defective. The script is, at some places, hard to decipher because of wear and the condition of the vellum. Fols 27-33 have holes and are damaged at the top and the bottom, close to the spine. Fols 36-37 are damaged in the same manner. Fols 1, 3, 5, 17, 24, 27, 38 and 39 have tears or holes. Fols 39, 40 and 48 show traces of once having been used as binding material.

layout.p: Written in double columns except from fols 6, 13, 29 and 39-48 (mostly Njáls saga) which are written in one column. There are 42 to 57 lines per page.
The flourished majuscules are either red or green with a flourishing in the contrasting colour. Rubrics and some initials in red.

handNote.p: It has been suggested that Jón Oddsson was the scribe of the manuscript (Scott, Eyrbyggja saga 110* ).

decoNote.p: Three historierated initials occur on ff. 1va, 16rb and 20rb. All three are copies of the corresponding initials in Flateyjarbók (ff. 9va, 60vb and 65vb).

additions.p: In the bottom margins of the codex, some notes in red ink by the scribe and some proverbs are found.

accMat.p:
There are two AM-slips: the recto of the a-slip writes: Olafs Saga Tryggvasonarvantar
[vantar mikid ï] Allar 3 arkirnar eru
samstaðar og vantar
ekki í nema við end
ann hefr
druvïs upphaf enn
adrar.
þattur af þorsteini Uxa
fot.
þattur af Nornagest.
þattur Helga Þorissonar.
Hallla þattur, vantar
endann.
communicavit Th. Th. . The verso has a copy of two of the rubrics: ættar t… and huerir konungar styrt hafa noregi. The b-slip has:Aptan af LaxdælaSgu
framan af Eyrbyggiu
ur Grettis Sgu
þetta fragment er mitt,
og heyrer manifeste til
hins fragmentsens qvod
communicavit. Th. Th.
hvar ä er partur framan
af Olafs Sgu Tr. s.
Eg true eg hafi þetta
feinged fra Bæ i Floa.

origin.p:
The manuscript, or at least the first part, was written in Iceland in 1498. On fol. 1ra:36-39 the scribe states: hann [Ólafr Hákonarson] var þa konungr er su
bok uar skrifud er þessi bok uar eptir skrifud þa var lidit fra hingad
bvrd uors herra iesv christi. M. CCC. LXXX. ok siau ꜳr. enn nu erv
fra hans hingadburd er sia bok er skrifud M. CCCC. nivtigir ok atta ar.

provenance.p:
In the bottom margin of fol. 17v the scribe added: on odds son ꜳ mik
ok er ecki nema hans eign . According to Árni Magnússon's account on fol. 58v-59r in his catalogue of Icelandic parchment manuscripts (AM 435 a 4to) fols 1-26 belonged to the Church of Skálholt and later to bishop, Jón Vídalín. Árni seem to remember that he got the rest from Bær in Flóa: Ur Olafs Sỏgu Tryggvasonar fragment.
þattur af þorsteini uxafot.
Þattur af Nornagesti.
þattur Helga þoris sonar.
Halla þattur vantar vid endann.
4to majori, óinnbunded. feinged af
Mag. Jone Wid. hefur fyrrum heyrt
Skalholltz kirkiu til.eda og leiged i Skal
hollte epter, af bokum Mag. Bryniolfs. þó mun hitt helldur vera.
Aptan af Laxdæla Sỏgu.
framan af Eyrbyggia Sỏgu.
vantar nú ur Grettis Sỏgu.
þetta þrent minner mig eg feinged hafi
fra Bæ i Floa. Er manifeste ur
sama Codice, og lagde eg þad þvi þar
saman vid: ut voluminis antiqva
ratio /:qvantum in me esset/: Sibi
constaret.

Scott (Eyrbyggja Saga: The vellum tradition106*) has, however, raised doubt about the reliability of Árni's account, arguing that in 1692 (which was the year Þorlákur Þórðarson brought with him several manuscripts from Iceland to Denmark) Jón Vídalín was not yet in a position to dispose of manuscripts belonging to the church and that Árni must have confused him with his predecessor Þórður Þorláksson (Thorlacius).

acquisition.p: It seems possible that Þórlákur Þórðarson delivered a part, or all, of AM 309 4to, as a part of a larger group of manuscripts, to Árni Magnússon in 1692.

custEvent.p: During the conservation 03 March 1969 to 15 January 1970 the manuscript was bound by Birgitte Dall.
